alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:58AM EST until December 18 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 800 AM EST. * At 458 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waymart, Prompton, Pleasant Mount, Aldenville, Prompton State Park and Beech Grove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
